page.title: 08 FARMING
page.content: THERE ARE DIFFERENT KINDS OF FARMS ALL OVER THE WORLD. IN OUR AREA THE MAIN TYPE OF FARMING IS DAIRY FARMING WERE THEY KEEP COWS FOR MILKING. THE COWS ARE MILKED BY MILKING MACHINES IN LARGE SHEDS. THE MILK IS KEPT IN STORAGE TANKS UNTIL LIFTED BY A TANKER WHICH TAKES IT AWAY FOR DRINKING. SOME FARMS KEEP PIGS FOR PORK,SHEEP FOR WOOL AND HENS FOR EGGS. SOME FARMERS GROW BARLEY WHICH IS CUT BY A MACHINE CALLED A COMBINE. THE STRAW IT LEAVES BEHIND IS BALED BY A BALER. THE WHEAT IS TAKEN IN BY A TRAILER TO THE FARM. A SILAGE CUTTER IS A MACHINE TOWED BY A TRACTOR WHICH CUTS GRASS FOR SILAGE.THE SILAGE IS STORED IN A PIT FOR THE COWS TO EAT OVER WINTER.THE PLOUGH IS A SIMPLE MACHINE WHICH TURNS THE GROUND OVER FOR GROWING POTATOES.
